summary_detail.value: Three fires comprise the Sapphire Complex: Little Hogback, Goat Creek, and Sliderock fires. Mike Almas’ Northern Rockies Type II Incident Management Team (IMT) is managing the incident. The fires are burning in steep, rocky terrain between the Rock Creek and Upper Willow Creek drainages. Fire managers will hold a public meeting jointly for both the Sapphire Complex and the Meyers Fire TONIGHT at 5:30 p.m. at the Granite County High School library.     Little Hogback Fire: 30,929 acres, 30% contained.      Wednesday, the fire continued to back downhill along the southwestern flank between upper Sheep Gulch and Capron Creek, resulting in the evacuation of three structures in Capron Creek drainage, along Rock Creek Road. Fire managers continue to seek opportunities to complete indirect line and secure firelines along the southwest corner where fire intensity and treacherous terrain continue to hamper containment efforts. Firefighters may need to perform a small burnout operation in...

title: Sapphire Complex Daily Update 08.31.2017 (Sapphire Complex Wildfire)
